amendatorysection.catchline: Notarial protest as evidence of dishonor; bill of exchange or promissory note.
amendatorysection.para: The usual protest by a notary public, without proof of his signature or notarial seal, is evidence of the dishonor and notice of a bill of exchange or promissory note.

annotation.para: Certificate of notary is evidence of notice as well as protest. Williams v. Parks, 63 Neb. 747, 89 N.W. 395 (1902).
